moves.1... e5 2. g3: i decided to play something unusual for me: the control of light squares.
moves.5. cxd5 cxd5 6. d4: destructuring the center. I am not sure it is correct, but I secretely hoped to isolate his pawn, even at a cost of a tempo: exd 7. Qxd4 Nc6 8. Qd1.
moves.6... e4: but of course no... my plans never work
moves.7. Bg5: so now other plan: i have a useless bishop, i still have a good control on light square... i want to destroy these pawns... I had a few moves to make.
moves.7... Be7 8. e3 Nc6 9. Nge2: now, my plans were to put my knight on f5, takes his f-knight and capture the center pawns.
moves.9... Bg4: ... but i had to delay this plan
moves.11. Kxe2: Haha! I surprised you, buddy! I thought that the only problem my king could have by not catling here was the opposite queen,,, which i had planned to exchange in the next few moves...
moves.11... Na5: this is a huge mistake, giving me a tempo
moves.12. Qb5+ Nc6 13. Bxf6: accomplishing my plan, delayed for a long time!
moves.13... Bxf6 14. Qxd5: now, I want to exchange and take the second pawn, if it is possible.
moves.18... Nb4: of course! I should have played a3 before!
moves.20. Rc2 b5 21. Be4: the plan to pin my horse is a bit slow
moves.23. a3 Nc6 24. Bxc6: I hate horses when they are my opponent's... :-)
moves.24... Rxc6 25. Ne4 Rdc8: doubled: this means although I am 2 pawns ahead, I am defending again...
moves.26. Kg2: this is my second huge mistake. Ke2 was of course necessary
moves.26... Rc6c2 27. Rxc2 Rxc2: now he is in... but only one rook: no panic
moves.28. b4 f5: anyway, I intended to exchange the horse with the bishop
moves.30. bxc5: here I hesitated... and actually it turned to be dangerous. Although the next moves are mostly mistakes, I wonder if, anyway, letting him a majority on a-b side is or not a huge mistake.
moves.32. a4: well, less logical, but I was at a loss of ideas... I should have played h3, then g4... but TIME!!!
moves.32... b4: of course!!! now he is the dangerous one!
moves.34. a5: of course! to prevent a5 now!
moves.34... g5 35. Kg2: why on earth did I do that??? totally unnecessary... but not too dangerous
moves.37... Ke6: he may think of a draw, now
moves.38... Kd5 39. g4 fxg4+ 40. hxg4 h4: and i create a new threat for myself!!!!
moves.42. f3+: expelling the king, but creating a weakness on e3...
moves.42... Kd5 43. Kh3 Rc3: and now his Rc3 is a good move.
moves.44... Rxe3: but now, i have a new weakness on d4
moves.47. Rb6: threatening two moves... but i was expecting Rxd4, because if i take the a6 pawn, he takes my c-pawn, and then my a pawn falls... and he turns better...
moves.47... Rxa5: and this is his biggest mistake. Now, I win!
moves.52... Kd3 53. c8=Q: Unless you see something I did not... this is the end...
moves.53... Ke3 54. Qc3+ Kf4 55. Rf6#: and even d4 plays a role in this mate situation. Thank you brave pawns!

gameName: 5 minutes game full of funny things
